subject: Re: [junit] Re: HOW TO ASK QUESTIONS ON THIS GROUP - FAQ  proposal
msgSnippet: Hmmm... good start. There should be a brief section on JUnit resources early on. (?) 1. The Basics 1.1 What is JUnit? 1.2 What is unit testing? Functional
messageBody:
Hmmm... good start. There should be a brief section on JUnit resources
early on.
(?)

1. The Basics
1.1 What is JUnit?
1.2 What is unit testing? Functional testing?
1.3 Where do I find documentation?
1.4 How do I report bugs? [+ sample ]
1.5 How do I get help? [+ mailing list archives,
mailing list ]
1.6 Other resources (major sites/articles)

[ This leads to a question- how *do* you access the mailing list archives?
The way I accessed them was to link the yahoo group to a yahoo mail
account. Is this the only way to access them? If so, I wouldn't be
surprised that people don't search them before posting. What if you don't
have/want a yahoo mail account? In any case, this should be described in
the FAQ. ]

I would suggest moving discussions of test-first, XP, etc. to their own
section, and mostly referring to the various existing articles/sites.

On Tue, 16 Oct 2001, Jim Cheesman wrote:

> I'm willing to help out with a FAQ for this mailing list: though I can't
> promise I'll do all of it ;)
>
> Here's my proposal for a list of topics; I can already see various items
> that I can't answer (I don't do extreme programming, I don't use an ide...)
>
>
> Junit FAQ v0.0.1
>
> 1 The Basics
> 1.1 What is Junit?
> 1.2 What is unit testing? Functional testing?
> 1.3 What is black/white box testing?
> 1.4 What is extreme programming? "Test first" programming?
> 1.5 What are the limitations of Junit?
>
> 2 Installation
> 2.1 What do I need?
> 2.2 Where can I get it?
> 2.3 How do I integrate this with ant?
>
> 2.4 IDE Integration
> 2.4.1 Netbeans
> 2.4.2 VAJ
> 2.4.3 ???
>
> 3 How do I test...
> 3.1 public variables and functions?
> 3.2 "friendly"/protected variables and functions?
> 3.3 private variables/functions?
> 3.4 servlets/jsps?
> 3.5 ejb's?
> 3.6 interfaces
> 3.7 Database operations (JDBC)
>
> 4 Misc.
> 4.1 What are mock objects?
> 4.2 Where can I get more information?
>
>
>
> --
>
> * Jim Cheesman *
